alert.note: Alert for Monroe Middle Keys (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Key West (Key West - The Florida Keys)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 20 at 11:45PM EDT by NWS Key West
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Middle Keys in Monroe County through 1215 AM EDT... At 1144 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Marathon, moving north at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and penny size hail. Marathon Airport reported a peak wind gust of 56 mph at 1138 PM. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Marathon, East End Of Seven Mile Bridge, Boot Key, Grassy Key, Knight Key and Key Colony Beach. This includes US 1 between mile markers 46 and 60. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
